Field.Description: Sub-type qualification/identification of the SecurityType. As an example for SecurityType(167)="REPO", the SecuritySubType="General Collateral" can be used to further specify the type of REPO. If SecuritySubType is used, then SecurityType is required. For SecurityType="MLEG" a name of the option or futures strategy name can be specified, such as "Calendar", "Vertical", "Butterfly". For SecurityType(167)="OPT" the subclassification can be specified, such as "Asian". For SecurityType(167)="SWAPTION" a value of "Straddle" is used to identify a straddle swaption. In the context of EU SFTR reporting use the appropriate 4-character code noted in the regulations - "GENE" for general collateral or "SPEC" for specific collateral (without quote marks).

Field.Elaboration: For EU SFTR reporting use the appropriate 4-character code noted in the regulations. See SFTR ITS "Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2019/363" Annexes 1 to 2 for values. For other agreement type use OTHR and the name of the agreement concatenated with a hyphen, e.g. OTHR-<IndexName>.

In the context of Dodd-Frank, all values shown except for 4 (Net exposure) apply. In the context of ESMA EU SFTR reporting only the values 1 (Uncollateralized), 3 (Fully collateralized) and 4 (Net exposure) apply.

Field.Name: CollateralReinvestmentRate
Field.Description: Interest rate received for collateral reinvestment.
Field.Elaboration: In the context of EU SFTR this is the reinvestment interest rate received from cash collateral made by the lender. If there are multiple reinvestment types, this is an average rate.

Field.Name: UnderlyingRefID
Field.Description: Identifies the underlying instrument the entity applies to by referencing the underlying instrument's UnderlyingID(2874).

Field.Name: CollateralReinvestmentAmount
Field.Description: The cash amount of the specified re-investment type.

Field.Name: CollateralReinvestmentCurrency
Field.Description: The currency denomination of the re-invested cash amount. Uses ISO 4217 currency codes.

Field.Name: CollateralReinvestmentType
Field.Description: Indicates the type of investment the cash collateral is re-invested in.

Field.Name: NoCollateralReinvestments
Field.Description: Number of instances of CollateralReinvestmentType(2844) in the repeating group.

Field.Name: FundingSource
Field.Description: Specifies the funding source used to finance margin or collateralized loan.

Field.Name: FundingSourceCurrency
Field.Description: Currency denomination of the market value of the funding source. Uses ISO 4217 currency codes.

Field.Name: FundingSourceMarketValue
Field.Description: Market value of the funding source.

Field.Name: NoFundingSources
Field.Description: Number of instances of FundingSource(2846) in the repeating group.

Field.Name: LegPaymentStreamOtherDayCount
Field.Description: The industry name of the day count convention not listed in LegPaymentStreamDayCount(40283).

Field.Name: MarginDirection
Field.Description: Indicates whether the margin described is posted or received.

Field.Name: PaymentFixedRate
Field.Description: The rate applicable to the fixed rate payment.

Field.Name: PaymentFloatingRateIndex
Field.Description: The payment floating rate index. See SpreadOrBenchmarkCurveData(221) for suggested values.

Field.Name: PaymentFloatingRateIndexCurvePeriod
Field.Description: Time unit multiplier for the floating rate index.

Field.Name: PaymentFloatingRateIndexCurveUnit
Field.Description: Time unit associated with the floating rate index.

Field.Name: PaymentFloatingRateSpread
Field.Description: Spread from floating rate index.

Field.Name: PaymentFrequencyPeriod
Field.Description: Time unit multiplier for the payment frequency.

Field.Name: PaymentFrequencyUnit
Field.Description: Time unit associated with the payment frequency.

Field.Name: PaymentRateResetFrequencyPeriod
Field.Description: Time unit multiplier for the floating rate reset frequency.

Field.Name: PaymentRateResetFrequencyUnit
Field.Description: Time unit associated with the floating rate reset frequency.

Field.Name: PaymentStreamOtherDayCount
Field.Description: The industry name of the day count convention not listed in PaymentStreamDayCount(40742).

Field.Name: SideCollateralReinvestmentRate
Field.Description: Interest rate received for collateral reinvestment.
Field.Elaboration: In the context of EU SFTR this is the reinvestment interest rate received from cash collateral made by the lender. If there are multiple reinvestment types, this is an average rate.

Field.Name: SideUnderlyingRefID
Field.Description: Identifies the underlying instrument the entity applies to by referencing the underlying instrument's UnderlyingID(2874).

Field.Name: NoSideCollateralReinvestments
Field.Description: Number of instances of SideCollateralReinvestmentType(2867) in the repeating group.

Field.Name: SideCollateralReinvestmentAmount
Field.Description: The cash amount of the specified re-investment type.

Field.Name: SideCollateralReinvestmentCurrency
Field.Description: The currency denomination of the re-invested cash amount. Uses ISO 4217 currency codes.

Field.Name: SideCollateralReinvestmentType
Field.Description: Indicates the type of investment the cash collateral is re-invested in.

Field.Name: CollateralizationValueDate
Field.Description: Date when the collateral is to be assessed or assigned.

Field.Name: RegulatoryReportTypeBusinessDate
Field.Description: The business date on which the event identified in RegulatoryReportType(1934) took place.
Field.Elaboration: In the context of EU SFTR reports with a RegulatoryReportType(1934) value 7 (Post-trade valuation), 31 (Collateral update) or 32 (Margin update), the business date on which the business event took place, which results in the information contained in the report.

Field.Name: ClearingPortfolioID
Field.Description: When the transaction is cleared and included in a portfolio of transactions this identifies the portfolio by its unique identifier.
Field.Elaboration: In the context of EU SFTR reporting this applies to cleared transactions grouped in a portfolio for which margins are exchanged.

Field.Name: NoTransactionAttributes
Field.Description: Number of instances of TransactionAttributeType(2872) in the repeating group.

Field.Name: TransactionAttributeType
Field.Description: Type of attribute(s) or characteristic(s) associated with the transaction.

Field.Name: TransactionAttributeValue
Field.Description: Value associated with the specificed TransactionAttributeType(2872).

Field.Name: UnderlyingID
Field.Description: Unique identifier for the underlying instrument within the context of a message.
Field.Elaboration: The UnderlyingID(2874) can be referenced by other fields, for example UnderlyingRefID(tbd2841) and SideUnderlyingRefID(2863), from other components . The scope of uniqueness is agreed upon between counterparties.

Field.Name: UnderlyingPaymentStreamOtherDayCount
Field.Description: The industry name of the day count convention not listed in UnderlyingPaymentStreamDayCount(40572).

Field.Name: PosAmtPrice
Field.Description: The price used to calculate the PosAmt(708).
Field.Elaboration: This may be used for certain PosAmtType(707) values where the PosAmt(708) is based on the current price of the position's security. In the context of EU SFTR reporting, this is the price used to calculate the loan value for securities loan and borrowing, and buy-sell back. The price may be expressed in units or percentage of the underlying security, yield or an absolute amount that ignores netting. For Buy/Sellback it expresses the initial spot price.

Field.Name: PosAmtPriceType
Field.Description: Specifies the type of price for PosAmtPrice(2876).

Field.Name: TerminationDate
Field.Description: The date of a contract's early termination or other post-trade event when the event is prior to the contract natural end or maturity not defined as part of the security's reference data or contractual terms/agreement.

Field.Name: CouponOtherDayCount
Field.Description: The industry name of the day count convention not listed in CouponDayCount(1950).

Field.Name: LegCouponOtherDayCount
Field.Description: The industry name of the day count convention not listed in LegCouponDayCount(2165).

Field.Name: UnderlyingCouponOtherDayCount
Field.Description: The industry name of the day count convention not listed in UnderlyingCouponDayCount(1993).

Enum.Elaboration: For Securities Financing indicates the receipt of securities or collateral.
For Securities Financing indicates the delivery of securities or collateral.

For regulatory reporting. ID values include: A = Assurance undertaking authorized in accordance with Directive 2002/83/EC C=Credit institution authorized in accordance with Directive 2006/48/EC F=Investment firm in accordance with Directive 2004/39/EC I=Insurance undertaking authorized in accordance with Directive 73/239/EC L=Alternative investment fund managed by AIFMs authorized or registered in accordance with Directive 2011/61/EC O=Institution for occupational retirement provision within the meaning of Article 6(a0 of Directive 2003/41/EC R=Reinsurance undertaking authorized in accordance with Directive 2005/68/EC U=UCITS and its management company, authorized in accordance with Directive 2009/65/EC or blank in case of coverage by LEI or in case of non-financial counterparties. In the context of EU SFTR reporting use the appropriate 4- or 1-character code noted in the regulations. See SFTR ITS "Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2019/363" Annexes 1 and 2 for values.
See also ISO 15022 MICO code 'A001'.
See also ISO 15022 MICO code 'A007'.
See also ISO 15022 MICO code 'A004'.
See also ISO 15022 MICO code 'A005'.
See also ISO 15022 MICO code 'A010'.
See also ISO 15022 MICO code 'A006'.
See also ISO 15022 MICO code 'A008'.
See also ISO 15022 MICO code 'A009'.
See also ISO 15022 MICO code 'A014'.

The contract can be extended by either party usually with a specific time notice prior to the expiry date. In the context of EU SFTR reporting this corresponds to "termination optionality" code "ETSB".
Registered money market fund. In the context of EU SFTR reporting this corresponds to code "MMFT".
Any commingled pool other than money market fund. In the context of EU SFTR reporting this corresponds to code "OCMP".
The repurchase agreement market. In the context of EU SFTR reporting this corresponds to code "REPM".
In the context of EU SFTR reporting this corresponds to code "SDPU".
In the context of EU SFTR reporting this corresponds to code "OTHR".
Repurchase agreements or Buy Sellbacks. In the context of EU SFTR reporting this corresponds to code "REPO".
Cash collateral from securities lending. In the context of EU SFTR reporting this corresponds to code "SECL".
In the context of EU SFTR reporting this corresponds to code "FREE".
Proceeds from customer short sales. In the context of EU SFTR reporting this corresponds to code "CSHS".
Proceeds from broker short sales. In the context of EU SFTR reporting this corresponds to code "BSHS".
In the context of EU SFTR reporting this corresponds to code "UBOR".
In the context of EU SFTR reporting this corresponds to code "OTHR".
The party or account that is the object of the report posted margin.
The party or account that is the object of the report received margin.

In the context of securities borrowing and lending transaction, an indication of whether the borrower has exclusive access to borrow from the lender's securities portfolio. Not applicable to commodities. TransactionAttributeValue(2873) takes Y or N value.
Indication of whether the collateral taker can reuse the securities provided as collateral for the transaction. TransactionAttributeValue(tbd2873) takes Y or N value.

In the context of securities financing transactions, indicates the type of collateral arrangement. For EU SFTR reporting, TransactionAttributeValue(2873) may take ESMA assigned values "TTCA" (title transfer), "SICA" (securities financial interest), or "SIUR" (securities financial interest with right of use).

Enum.Description: Euro Overnight Index Average Swap Rate

Enum.Elaboration: Replaces EONIA.

Enum.Description: DTCC General Collateral Finance Repo Index

Enum.Elaboration: Replaces LIBOR.

Enum.Description: Bank of Israel Interbank Offered Rate

Enum.Elaboration: In the context of EU SFTR reporting the identifier of the CSD participant or indirect participant of the reporting counterparty. Where both the CSD participant and indirect participant are involved in the transaction this should identify the indirect participant.
The issuer of the security.
The number of shares, par value of bonds or commodity contracts on loan or borrowed.
Principal amount of a securities financing transaction on matuity date.
The amount of the outstanding margin loan. In the event that the loan has a short market value, PosAmt(708) would be a negative value.
The amount of the loan.

Supplemental to party sub-ID type "64" (Company activities) for regulatory reporting. For EU SFTR reporting use the appropriate 4-character code noted in the regulations applying the conditional association rules. See SFTR ITS "Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2019/363" Annexes 1 and 2 for values.

May be used, when appropriate, to explicitly indicate the transaction side of the party, e.g. Buyer, Seller, Lender, Borrower, Maker, Taker, etc. in the ID. In the context of EU SFTR reporting, use values as required by SFTR, "GIVE" and "TAKE" in the ID, to identify collateral giver and taker.
ISO Country Code where the registered office of the party is located as specified in the LEI reference data.
A modification of the details of the collateral re-use. In the context of EU SFTR reporting, to be used with RegulatoryReportType(1934)=31 (Collateral update).
In the context of EU SFTR reporting, indicates that the transaction is to be or was settled using the DBV mechanism.
In the context of EU SFTR reporting this corresponds to "action type" "NEWT".
In the context of EU SFTR reporting this corresponds to "action type" "CORR".
In the context of EU SFTR reporting this corresponds to "action type" "MODI".
In the context of EU SFTR reporting this corresponds to "action type" "COLU" if CollStatus(910)=3 (Assigned (Accepted)), or "REUU" if CollStatus(910)=5 (Reused).
In the context of EU SFTR reporting this corresponds to "action type" "MARU".
In the context of EU SFTR reporting this corresponds to "action type" "EROR".
In the context of EU SFTR reporting this corresponds to "action type" "ETRM".
Indication of whether the collateral has been provided for a net exposure, rather than for a single transaction.
The transaction/contract has closed before its natural end (maturity date or end date).
A main index identified as a security type, for example under EU SFTR reporting.

Interest is calculated based on a 30-day month in a way similar to the 30/360 (basic rule) and a 365-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month, except for February. This means that a 31 is assumed to be a 30 and the 28 February (or 29 February for a leap year) is assumed to be a 28 (or 29). See also ISO 15022 MICO code 'A002'.

Interest is calculated based on a 30-day month in a way similar to the 30/360 (basic rule) and the assumed number of days in a year in a way similar to the Actual/Actual (ICMA). Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month, except for February. This means that a 31 is assumed to be a 30 and the 28 February (or 29 February for a leap year) is assumed to be a 28 (or 29). The assumed number of days in a year is computed as the actual number of days in the coupon period multiplied by the number of interest payments in the year. See also ISO 15022 MICO code 'A003'.

Interest is calculated based on a 30-day month and a 360-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30 calendar day of the same month, except for February. This means that a 31 is assumed to be a 30 and the 28 February (or 29 February for a leap year) is assumed to be a 28 (or 29). It is the most commonly used 30/360 method for non-US straight and convertible bonds issued before 1 January 1999. See also ISO 15022 MICO code 'A011'.

Interest is calculated based on a 30-day month and a 360-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month, except for the last day of February whose day of the month value shall be adapted to the value of the first day of the interest period if the latter is higher and if the period is one of a regular schedule. This means that a 31 is assumed to be a 30 and the 28 February of a non-leap year is assumed to be equivalent to a 29 February when the first day of the interest period is a 29, or to a 30 February when the first day of the interest period is a 30 or a 31. The 29 February of a leap year is assumed to be equivalent to a 30 February when the first day of the interest period is a 30 or a 31. Similarly, if the coupon period starts on the last day of February, it is assumed to produce only one day of interest in February as if it was starting on a 30 February when the end of the period is a 30 or a 31, or two days of interest in February when the end of the period is a 29, or three days of interest in February when it is the 28 February of a non-leap year and the end of the period is before the 29. See also ISO 15022 MICO code 'A012'.

Interest is calculated based on a 30-day month and a 360-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month. This means that a 31 is assumed to be a 30 and the 28 February (or 29 February for a leap year) is assumed to be equivalent to a 30 February. It is a variation of the 30E/360 (or Eurobond basis) method where the last day of February is always assumed to be a 30, even if it is the last day of the maturity coupon period. See also ISO 15022 MICO code 'A013'.
For other day count method. See also ISO 15022 MICO code 'OTHR'.
In the context of EU SFTR reporting, identifies the third party, not necessarily the custodian, to which the reporting counterparty has outsourced the post-trade processing of an SFT (if applicable).
In the context of EU SFTR reporting, identifies the agent lender involved in the securities lending transaction.
Estimated market valuation of collateral. In the context of EU SFTR this may be used for value of re-use of collateral.

The contract automatically renews after the expiry date until one party gives the other notice to terminate. In the context of EU SFTR reporting this corresponds to "termination optionality" code "EGRN".
Contract is callable.
Contract is puttable.

Fee that the borrower of the security or commodity pays to the lender. The basis rate is specified in PaymentFixedRate(43097). A security lending fee payment may be periodic, in which case specify PaymentFrequencyPeriod(43102) and PaymentFrequencyUnit(43103).

For contracts calling for rebate payment(s), e.g. Securities Lending, normally specified as a fixed or floating rate rather than a fixed amount. A rebate payment may be periodic, in which case specify PaymentFrequencyPeriod(43102) and PaymentFrequencyUnit(43103).
Applicable to PaymentType(40213)=14 (Rebate) for which PaymentFixedRate(43097) and its qualifiers supersede PaymentAmount(40217).
Applicable to PaymentType(40213)=14 (Rebate) for which PaymentFloatingRateIndex(43098) and its qualifiers supersede PaymentAmount(40217).

Component.Elaboration: MiscFeesGrp should be used to convey fees related to the transaction (e.g. taxes, transaction based fees, etc.) and should not be used to specify payments based on the price or terms of the contract (e.g. upfront fee, premium amount, security lending fee, contract-based rebates, related fee resets, payment frequency, etc.). For contractual payments use the PaymentGrp component instead.

This component is positioned outside the Instrument component as it is used to specify payments based on the price and terms of the contract, e.g. upfront fee, premium amount, security lending fee and contract-based rebates. When PaymentFrequencyUnit(43103) and PaymentFrequencyPeriod(43102) are specified the payments are deemed to be periodic for the specified PaymentType(40213).

Component.Name: CollateralReinvestmentGrp
Component.Description: The CollateralReinvestmentGrp component block is a repeating group that may be used to provide a breakdown of the cash collateral's reinvestment types and amounts (e.g. CollateralType(1704)="CASH").

Component.Name: FundingSourceGrp
Component.Description: This component is used to specify the funding source(s) used to finance a margin loan or collateralized loan.

Component.Name: TransactionAttributeGrp
Component.Description: The TransactionAttributeGrp component block is a repeating group that may be used to provide additional transaction attributes for the trade and other post-trade events.

Component.Name: SideCollateralReinvestmentGrp
Component.Description: The SideCollateralReinvestmentGrp component block is a repeating group that may be used to provide a breakdown of the cash collateral's reinvestment types and amounts (e.g. SideCollateralType(2701)="CASH").

MsgContent.Description: Either PaymentAmount(40217), PaymentFixedRate(43097) or PaymentRFloatingRateIndex(43098) must be specified.
May be used when the business event date differs from when the regulatory report is actually being submitted (typically specified in TrdRegTimestamps component).
May be used when the business event date differs from when the regulatory report is actually being submitted (typically specified in TrdRegTimestamps component).
May be used when the business event date differs from when the regulatory report is actually being submitted (typically specified in TrdRegTimestamps component).
May be used when the business event date differs from when the regulatory report is actually being submitted (typically specified in TrdRegTimestamps component).
May be used to specify the average reinvestment rate when there are multiple instances of the CollateralReinvestmentGrp.
May be used to indicate that this entry applies to the underlying collateral instrument being referenced by the value in UnderlyingID(2874).
Required if NoCollateralReinvestments(2845) > 0.
Required if NoFundingSources(2849) > 0.
May be used to specify a count method not listed in LegPaymentStreamDayCount(40283).
Either PaymentAmount(40217), PaymentFixedRate(43097) or PaymentFloatingRateIndex(43098) must be specified.
Either PaymentAmount(40217), PaymentFixedRate(43097) or PaymentFloatingRateIndex(43098) must be specified.
Conditionally required when PaymentFloatingRateIndexCurvePeriod(43099) is specified.
Conditionally required when PaymentFloatingRateIndexCurveUnit(43100) is specified.
Conditionally required when PaymentFloatingRateIndex(43098) is specified and the spread to the index is not "zero". When the spread to the index is "zero" this may be omitted.
Conditionally required when PaymentRateResetFrequencyPeriod(43104) is specified.
Conditionally required when PaymentRateResetFrequencyUnit(43105) is specified.
Conditionally required when PaymentFrequencyPeriod(43102) is specified.
Conditionally required when PaymentFrequencyUnitPeriod(43103) is specified.
May be used to specify a count method not listed in PaymentStreamDayCount(40742).
Required if NoTransactionAttributes(2871) > 0.
When multiple instances of the SideCollateralReinvestmentGrp component are present this field specifies the average reinvestment rate.
May be used to indicate that this entry applies to the underlying collateral instrument being referenced by the value in UnderlyingID(2874).
Required if NoSideCollateralReinvestments(2864) > 0.

Used for unique identification of the underlying instance that can subsequently be used to serve as input value for fields such as UnderlyingRefID(2841), for example, whenever a simple underlying reference is allowed or needed.
May be used to specify a count method not listed in UnderlyingPaymentStreamDayCount(40572).
